intro: Altensteinia mandonii, commonly known as the Madagascar orchid, is a rare and unique species native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, colorful flowers that resemble those of other orchid genera. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in rocky or forested areas. Its botanical features include slender stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Altensteinia mandonii is considered an endangered species.
